S. Bryanion, the great founder of the ascetis life in the West, was born in the environs of Nursia a city of Umbria in Italy, about the year 480. Of his father Eutropius, and his mother Abundantia, nothing is known, except that his family was honourable. He was sent in his youth to study in Rome; but he soon became alanned by the vice of the young men his companions, and secretly retired to Sublacum, in Italian, Subiaco, about forty miles distant, where he ¹ shut himself up in a narrow cave. On his way thither he met Romnum, a holy monk, whom he informed of his purpose, and who clothed him in a
